# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    code_blocks = findall(r"^\s*```julia\n((?:\S|\n)*?)^\s*```", md)
    # We have a single code block if the length of `code_blocks` is 1
    if length(code_blocks) == 1
        return strip(replace(md[code_blocks[1][2]:code_blocks[1][end-1]], r"^```julia\n|\s*```"m => ""))
    else
        # Otherwise, join the code blocks with a newline and return the result
        return join([strip(replace(md[b[2]:b[end-1]], r"^```julia\n|\s*```"m => "")) for b in code_blocks], "\n")
    end
end

# Testing with the provided example
extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""") == "println(\"hello world\")\n"
